definition: to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: European Inter-bank lending rates fell after the ECB's press conference.
sentences.chinese: 央行新聞發佈會召開之後歐洲銀行間拆借利率下跌。
銀行間隔夜拆借利率超過了13%。

sentences.english: Interbank lending rates have come down and stabilized, but banks are not yet lending.
sentences.chinese: 同業拆借利率已經下調和穩定，但銀行尚未放款。

sentences.english: They can be bought, sold, borrowed, lent, swapped and hedged.
sentences.chinese: 可以買賣，出售，拆借，租賃，對換，套期。

sentences.english: Making inter-bank borrowing or lending in violation of regulations"."
Interest is determined in accordance with ADB's LIBOR-based lending facility.
sentences.chinese: 利息按亞洲開發銀行以倫敦同業銀行間拆借利率計算。

definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to rotate/to circulate (cash, stock etc)/turnover/circulation/cash flow
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
